definition: surname Long/short for 吉隆坡[Ji2 long2 po1], Kuala Lumpur

sentences.english: It rolled on top of a sonorous vault.
sentences.chinese: 它在天頂上轟隆隆地行駛。
坦克轟隆轟隆地沿路開過。
坦克轟隆轟隆地沿路開過。

sentences.english: He led long a my hand to go home in the heavy rain bombing so.
sentences.chinese: 他就這樣，在轟隆隆的大雨中，牽着我的手回家了。

sentences.english: She followed him diffidently through the clattering machines.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他，怯生生地走過那些轟隆作響的機器。

sentences.english: The foghorn boomed out its warning.
sentences.chinese: 霧號轟隆隆地發出警告。
炮兵轟隆隆地發出十九響禮炮。

sentences.english: Years so rumbled out live another life in the slice.
sentences.chinese: 歲月就這麼轟隆隆攆過一個又一個生命中的切片。

sentences.english: Cease not your moaning you fierce old mother.
sentences.chinese: 不息的轟隆似憤怒老母。

sentences.english: The library crashed to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 圖書館轟隆一聲倒塌了。

sentences.english: Katie also heard the roar of a passenger express train as it rolled by.
sentences.chinese: 凱蒂也聽到了一列客車飛馳而過的轟隆聲。

sentences.english: Around him is the roar of equipment as huge tractor-like machines thunder past.
sentences.chinese: 幾輛巨大的像拖拉機一樣的機器轟隆隆的走過他身邊。

sentences.english: The roar of a jet plane vibrated the window.
sentences.chinese: 噴氣式飛機的轟隆聲震動着玻璃。

sentences.english: That is the sound of inevitability .
She heard a boom of thunder.
Somewhere through the roar sounded the terrified scream of some wounded animal.
sentences.chinese: 震耳欲聾的轟隆聲中分明夾雜着傷獸的咆哮。

definition: sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
